text: What’s more, your 360 Account comes with Money Lock built-in – our latest security feature that enables you to lock up the funds in your account to protect them from scams. And best yet, locked funds count towards the total account balance for the purpose of earning interest, so your savings can continue to grow while staying safe.

text: This plan is protected under the Policy Owner's Protection Scheme which is administered by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC). Coverage for your policy is automatic and no further action is required from you. For more information on the types of benefits that are covered under the scheme as well as the limits of coverage, where applicable, please contact us or visit the Life Insurance Association (LIA) or SDIC websites (www.lia.org.sgorwww.sdic.org.sg).

title: 360 Account

text: Base interest:This interest is accrued daily based on your account's day-end balance and you will receive this at the end of the month.

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Bonus interest:For the SIX types of bonus below, you will earn bonus interest at 3 tiers based on your account balance, up to the first S$100,000:

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn up to 4.0% a year for crediting your salary of at least S$1,800 through GIRO/FAST/PayNow via GIRO/PayNow via FAST and/or

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn up to 2.4% a year for increasing your account average daily balance by S$500 from the previous month and/or

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn up to 0.60% a year for spending at least S$500 on your OCBC 365 Credit Card, OCBC INFINITY Cashback Card, OCBC NXT Credit Card, OCBC 90°N and/or OCBC Rewards Card

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn up to 2.4% a year for 12 consecutive months when you purchase an eligible insurance product from OCBC and/or

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn up to 2.4% a year for 12 consecutive months when you purchase an eligible investment product from OCBC and/or

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Earn 2.4% a year if your account average daily balance is S$200,000 or more.

text: Each customer is only allowed to open ONE OCBC 360 Account where he/she is the Primary Account holder. The signing mandate can be either signed singly or joint alternate.

title: 360 Account
subtitle: Maximise your interest with 360 Account
text: Your FAST/ PayNow Transfer to your 360 Account might have a value date that is different from the transaction date. Funds received on a non-business day (for example, Sunday or public holidays) or after the Bank’s cut-off time on a business day will be valued on the next business day. The calculation of the average daily balance for each month depends on the value date of fund transfers.

Do note that funds received on a non-business day via FAST or PayNow (for example, Sunday or public holidays) will be valued on the next business day. If your funds have a value date that falls in the next calendar month, you will not be eligible for the Bonus Interest for that particular month.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: We will allow parents the flexibility to choose when to grant full control of the OCBC MyOwn Account to their child starting from when the child turns 16. This feature will be released by 30 June 2025. Eligible parents will be notified when this new feature is launched. When the child grows up, the OCBC MyOwn Account will eventually be transited to an adult account as well.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: Parents can choose to activate the OCBC Kill Switch via the OCBC app on the child’s behalf. To authorise this request, we will send an SMS OTP to the child’s number in our records.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: Once activated, the OCBC Kill Switch will immediately suspend the child’s current and savings accounts (including joint accounts), OCBC app access and debit cards.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: Children can also activate OCBC Kill Switch on their own via the OCBC app.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: As a preemptive measure to protect the child’s funds, consider locking them using OCBC Money Lock. Locked funds cannot be transferred out.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: Child can access the OCBC app > click on OCBC MyOwn Account > Lock card to temporary suspend further transactions on the card. If card is found, the child can repeat the steps to Unlock card and continue to make transactions.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: Parent may contact us at 1800 363 3333 or visit any OCBC branch to request for a card replacement. You will receive it via mail within 5 working days.

title: OCBC MyOwn Account
subtitle: Unlock your child’s financial superpowers
text: You will receive an email within 20 working days upon successful application of OCBC MyOwn Account. In the email, a redemption code will be indicated and you can visit the vending machines at these OCBC branches to redeem your pin:

title: Online Equities Account
subtitle: View your trades & savings in a single app
text: You can submit limit orders for buy and sell on our Online Equities Account. A limit order is an order to buy or sell an exchange traded instrument at a specific price or better. A buy limit order can only be executed at the limit price or lower, and a sell limit order can only be executed at the limit price or higher. The limit orders will be matched with opposite orders at the best price one by one in the system queue according to time priority. If that price is not met, your order will not be executed and will be placed in queue.

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: Is this a service provided by OCBC? Why is there a “powered by WeInvest” label on the platform?

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: OCBC RoboInvest is a collaboration between OCBC and a Fintech firm Planar Investments Pte Ltd (WeInvest). This brand new platform is developed and supported by WeInvest, with customised screens and investment flow for OCBC. And we are bringing this investment service exclusively to OCBC customers!

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: Please contact the email support IDSupport@OCBCRoboInvest.com. Our Fintech partner WeInvest supporting the platform will be able to assist you further. Typically, a response can be expected within the next business day.

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: What is the difference between OCBC RoboInvest’s service and OCBC Blue Chip Investment Plan (BCIP)?

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: OCBC’s Blue Chip Investment Plan (“BCIP”) aims to allow users to invest simply and gain exposure to the stock market. BCIP customers can select up to 20 share counters or ETF counters on the Straits Times Index for regular investment from as low as S$100. BCIP adopts the concept of Dollar Cost Averaging and customers can invest a chosen amount into their selected counters comfortably each month without timing the market. OCBC RoboInvest however, aims to provide customers with an easy way to steer their portfolio towards the strategy of their choice by following one preformulated strategies. By doing so, customers can gain exposure to Exchange-Traded Funds (“ETF”) and Equities, in Singapore and overseas markets. Unlike the BCIP, RoboInvest is not a regular savings plan and customers can curate the timing of investing their funds.

text: Estimated market value: The estimated market value of your investments as of the date reflected in the dashboard.

text: Unrealised profit / loss: The potential profit or loss in the value of your investments based on your initial investment value.

subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: These portfolios are constructed using listed ETFs and Equities representing major asset/sub-asset classes. These instruments chosen are liquid, well-diversified and have low expense ratios as we strive to maximise your returns and keep expenses low.

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: Can I customize the ETFs or equities in a portfolio?

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: The combination of ETFs or equities in each model portfolios are determined based on market research and insights. This allows us to provide the most optimal diversification personalised to you. It is therefore not possible for a customer to handpick the ETFs or the allocation.

This amount will be displayed after you have selected the ”Invest” option for any of your existing portfolio(s).

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)

text: What is OCBC RoboInvest’s portfolio methodology?

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: We screen for suitable Equities and ETFs using various qualitative and quantitative criteria (assets under management, expense ratio, historical performance, liquidity, underlying instruments etc).

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: The percentage allocation to each ETF is determined using our proprietary optimization algorithm and ETF-based portfolios are rebalanced quarterly or semi-annually as indicated in the portfolio detail.

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: Rebalancing is the process of adjusting the composition of an Investment portfolio. This involves the buying and selling of assets in an investment portfolio to maintain a desired asset allocation according to the market conditions. We will sell more if the stock value rises significantly, or buy more when the stock has declined to take advantage of volatility.

title: OCBC Roboinvest(Powered by WeInvest)
subtitle: Invest in what you believe in with RoboInvest
text: OCBC RoboInvest will periodically (quarterly or half-yearly depending on portfolios) trigger rebalancing. We will only proceed with the rebalancing once you have given your consent within 2 weeks from the date of trigger. You may choose to ignore or skip this rebalance as well.

text: The MCC is a four digit-number assigned by Visa/Mastercard to describe the main business activity of a merchant. It is determined by the merchant’s acquiring bank (a financial institution that accepts and processes credit and debit card transactions on behalf of merchants).

title: OCBC Rewards Card
subtitle: Refresh, redefine and reward yourself.Re: You.
text: As the card issuer, OCBC does not determine the main business activity of a merchant or the MCC assigned.

title: OCBC Rewards Card
subtitle: Refresh, redefine and reward yourself.Re: You.
text: We use MCCs to decide whether certain transactions qualify for OCBC$. For example, OCBC Rewards Cardmembers earn bonus OCBC$ only on transactions that fall under certain MCCs (e.g. MCC 5261 - Women's Ready to Wear Stores).

title: OCBC Rewards Card
subtitle: Refresh, redefine and reward yourself.Re: You.
text: If the merchant’s acquiring bank assigns it an incorrect MCC, we will not be able to reward you for transactions made there. For example, if a merchant was determined to be a ‘Tailor’ instead of a ‘Women’s Ready to Wear Store’, an OCBC Rewards Cardmember will not be able to earn bonus OCBC$ on transactions made there – since transactions under ‘MCC 5697 - Alterations, Mending, Seamstresses, Tailors’ do not qualify for bonus OCBC$.

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card

text: Transaction date refers to the date when a purchase is made.

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: Posting date refers to the date the transaction is received by the card issuer, OCBC Bank. As merchants may make a settlement a few days after the transaction has been made, posting date may be a few days later than the transaction date. As such, the bank has no control over when merchant records the transaction.

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: The cashback computation is based on the transactions posted within the calendar month.

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: The MCC is a four digit-number assigned by Visa/Mastercard to describe the main business activity of a merchant. It is determined by the merchant’s acquiring bank (a financial institution that accepts and processes credit and debit card transactions on behalf of merchants).

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: As the card issuer, OCBC does not determine the main business activity of a merchant or the MCC assigned.

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: We use MCCs to decide whether certain transactions qualify for cashback. For example, OCBC 365 Cardmembers earn cashback only on transactions that fall under certain MCCs (e.g. MCC 5812 – Eating places and Restaurant).

title: OCBC 365 Credit Card
subtitle: Enhanced cashback every day, everywhere
text: If the merchant’s acquiring bank assigns it an incorrect MCC, we will not be able to reward you for transactions made there. For example, if a merchant was determined to be a ‘Bar’ instead of a ‘Restaurant’, an OCBC 365 Cardmember will not be able to earn cashback on transactions made there – since transactions under ‘MCC 5813 – Bars, Taverns, Lounges, Disco’ do not qualify for cashback.

title: OCBC DEBIT CARD
subtitle: The card that gives you limitless cashback
text: WithOCBC Personal Bankingservices, you can get your OCBC Debit Card in 3 simple steps, with instant approval. Connect via MyInfo to apply for an OCBC Debit Card online > verify your details and submit the application > Get a link to access your digital card and use it instantly.Find out more.

title: OCBC DEBIT CARD
subtitle: The card that gives you limitless cashback
text: Log in to OCBC Online Banking with your access code and PIN or fingerprint ID and select “Card services” on the left menu. Navigate to “Activate credit/debit card” on the mobile app. If using your desktop, click on Customer service, and under “Cards”, select “Activate credit/debit card”. Begin to activate your card according to the prompts.Find out more.

title: OCBC DEBIT CARD
subtitle: The card that gives you limitless cashback
text: Log in to OCBC Online Banking with your access code and PIN or fingerprint ID and select “Card services” on the left menu. Navigate to “Change card daily limit” on the mobile app. If using your desktop, select onCustomer service, and under “Cards” select “Card withdrawal & spending limit”. Choose your OCBC Debit Card that you would like tocheck or change your limit for > update limit > tap on “Next” > Review and confirm. You’ll have to authorise this action using OneToken.Find out more.

Instructions on this arrangement is also available in the email that is sent to you upon application approval.

text: I did not provide my signature when I signed up for an EasiCredit. What should I do if I want to perform transactions that require the verification of signature?Please proceed to any OCBC branch where you can present to any OCBC staff a copy of your signature together with your original identification documents – NRIC or passport, to update your signature with the bank.

title: EASICREDIT
subtitle: Get standby cash wherever and whenever you need it
text: How can I apply for a chequebook?Successful EasiCredit applications via our website will not automatically come with a cheque book. If you require a cheque book, you can click on the link in the EasiCredit approval email or SMS that was sent to you after your application has been approved. After you have been verified, you may then proceed to select the option “Apply for Cheque Book”, upload your signature and click submit to apply for a cheque book. As this link is only available for 7 calendar days, you may also request for a cheque book via Internet Banking subsequently.

text: Car loan eligibility and quantum depends on several factors, including but not limited to your outstanding loan liabilities and monthly income. Depending on the open market value (OMV) of the vehicle, the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) limits financing up to 60%/70% of the purchase price.

title: Car Loan
subtitle: Finance your dream car with OCBC Car Loan.
text: AtOCBC Bank, we offer competitive interest rates for car loans and additional benefits with our Eco-Care product suite. Want to find out more about OCBC car loans? Email us atcarloans@ocbc.comto find out more.

title: Car Loan
subtitle: Finance your dream car with OCBC Car Loan.
text: A COE – or Certificate of Entitlement – gives you the right to own and use a vehicle in Singapore. The cost of getting a COE is also factored into a car loan. You can check the latest COE prices and bidding results in Singapore on theOneMotoring page. You can also use a loan calculator to find out the monthly instalments for your car purchases.

title: Car Loan
subtitle: Finance your dream car with OCBC Car Loan.
text: Loans usually come with an interest rate that is payable on top of the principal amount. To calculate the total loan amount you will need to repay, add the principal sum together with the interest. You can use an interest calculator, or use the following formula:

title: Car Loan
subtitle: Finance your dream car with OCBC Car Loan.
text: Interest payable = Loan amount * interest rate * (number of payments/12)

title: Car Loan

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: There are several key differences between a HDB Housing Loan and a Bank Loan. Customers will have to weigh between the different loan-to-value limits including initial cash outlay requirements, loan tenure, interest rates packages and their respective prepayment fees before deciding which best suit their needs.

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: Home loan rules and pricing can be complex, hence customers should speak to a mortgage specialist to gain a deeper understanding of the financial considerations involved.

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: Those looking to purchase a new private property can loan up to 75% of their property’s valuation or purchase price, whichever is lower. This applies to customers with no outstanding home loans. For example, if the property is valued and purchased at S$1,000,000, the maximum loan amount is S$750,000. Other factors such as the loan tenure, Loan-To-Value (LTV) or Total Debt Servicing Ratio (TDSR) will also affect the final loan amount.

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: If you already have an existing home loan with another bank, you can also considerrefinancing your home loanwith us and enjoy interest savings.

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: Having a bad credit score can affect your loan eligibility. AtOCBC Bank, our mortgage specialist will take into account your credit history as well as other factors such as your age, income and liabilities to assess your repayment ability.

title: Home Loan for HDB or Private Home
subtitle: Fast-forward your online home loan approval to 60 minutes
text: Speak to our mortgage specialists to find out how you can secure a housing loan and what documents you will need to provide.

If you are only looking for insurance coverage, you should consider if other insurance products may be more appropriate for you.

subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 1The amount of Welcome Bonus you receive will vary depending on the plan you choose and the basic regular premiums (i.e. excluding any rider premiums) you pay annually. To enjoy 40% Welcome Bonus in the first policy year, you can apply for Investment-linked Insurance Plan 2 – Choice 10 with a basic annual premium of S$12,000 or more. After paying each modal premium in the first policy year, you will receive the bonus in the form of units to be added to your account value. The number of units to be granted will depend on the unit price available on the next valuation date following our receipt of each premium payment during the first policy year. We regret that if you are on premium holiday or make a single premium top-up, you will not earn any Welcome Bonus.

title: Investment-linked insurance plan 2 (ILIP2)
subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 2The Loyalty Bonus you receive every year – starting from the end of the 10thpolicy year – will be equal to 0.30% of your policy’s value at the end of each policy year. As long as no partial withdrawals are made during the policy year for which the Loyalty Bonus is being paid for, you will receive the Loyalty Bonus in the form of extra units. The number of units to be granted will depend on the unit price available on the next valuation date following the end of the relevant policy year.

title: Investment-linked insurance plan 2 (ILIP2)
subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 3The Premium Bonus you receive will be equal to 2% of each basic regular premium (i.e. excluding any rider premiums) you pay, starting from the year shown below. To receive the bonus, a) all prevailing basic regular premiums must be paid up to date; and b) no partial withdrawals can be made from your policy within 12 months of the date the bonus would be payable to you.

title: Investment-linked insurance plan 2 (ILIP2)
subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 4The distribution of dividends may reduce the Net Asset Value of the fund, which is used to calculate the value of the fund and the benefits you will receive under your policy. The dividend rate and frequency will vary depending on the dividend-paying funds you have chosen. Dividend distributions are not guaranteed and are determined by the relevant fund manager in its absolute discretion.

title: Investment-linked insurance plan 2 (ILIP2)
subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 5From the second policy year, you may request to change the life assured – and do so up to two times during the policy term. If the change is approved, we will inform you in writing. For more details, please refer to the product summary.

title: Investment-linked insurance plan 2 (ILIP2)
subtitle: Start investing while getting insured, with 3 types of bonuses
text: 6The Death Benefit will be payable in one lump sum as follows, if the life assured dies:(a) 101% of total basic regular premiums paid plus 101% of total single premium top-ups paid (if any), less 101% of total partial withdrawals (if any, including any partial withdrawal charges); or(b) the account value,whichever is higher, less any debt (if any) owed under the policy.

text: For TPD that takes the form of total and irrecoverable loss of the sight in both eyes; the use of two limbs at or above the wrist or ankle; or the sight in one eye and the use of one limb at or above the wrist or ankle, coverage will be for the whole of the policy term. For other forms of TPD, it must occur before the policy anniversary on which the life assured is age 65. You are advised to refer to the policy contract for more details on TPD definitions.

text: Yes, you are able to purchase the plan as long as you have fully recovered and are diagnosed as negative for COVID-19.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance

text: We will follow all vaccination, pre-departure tests and post-arrival tests requirements imposed by the authorities.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance

text: For some countries, self-administered ART, PCR or other self-test kit will not be accepted for pre-departure COVID-19 test to fly out of Singapore.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance

text: You must make an appointment from the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers found on MOH website (https://www.moh.gov.sg/licensing-and-regulation/regulations-guidelines-and-circulars/details/list-of-COVID-19-swab-providers).

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: The COVID-19 Trip Cancellation coverage is claimable if you are forced to cancel your trip within the 30 days that it was due to start as a result of you, a relative, or a travel companion being diagnosed with COVID-19 by a medical practitioner in Singapore.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: No. COVID-19 is only applicable should the trip is permitted under the latest permitted travel arrangement as per Singapore Government travel advisory.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: You may refer tohttps://safetravel.ica.gov.sg/for more information on the latest travel advisories issued by the Singapore government.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: A medical practitioner has to diagnose that you are positive with COVID-19 while overseas. You are required to provide us with supporting documents such as Inpatient Discharge Summary Report (IPDS), doctor’s memo or diagnosis indicated on the Medical Certificate.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: A Medical practitioner is a person who is registered and legally qualified as a doctor, has a medical degree in Western medicine, and is authorized by the medical licensing authority of the relevant country to provide the medical or surgical services their licence and training relate to.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: The medical practitioner cannot be the insured or an insured person, or:

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: their husband, wife or unmarried partner;

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: their business partner, employer, employee or agent;

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: any person who is related to an insured person or the insured in any way, including by marriage or adoption.

title: Explorer Travel Insurance
subtitle: Get up to S$700k in coverage on medical expenses overseas
text: The policy is designed to protect you during your overseas journey. If you are diagnosed with COVID-19 upon arriving in Singapore, after your journey, you will not be covered by the policy.
